body.p: Your Petitioners beg leave to state that Charles Boynton is a school teacher in one of the Districts of the county. Directly after the passage of the law imposing an oath upon teachers. He being a subject of Great Britain, came to town and consulted with George W. Williams in regard to taken the oath in view of the fact of his being a subject of Great Britain. Geo. W Williams advised him not to take the oath, as he thought it would render him liable to the draft and be inconsistent with his duties as a said subject. He then designed quiting the school but his patrons and among the number your petitioner Jesse H. Boulden upon him to continue his school. He was indicted in Bourbon Circuit Court and fined at this term $25. He has since and more than a year ago taken the oath imposed by the legislature. He is a very poor man and has a family depending upon his labors and also a very worthy man.
Your petitioners therefore pray your Excellency to remit the fine imposed upon him

Geo. Warden
School Comr. B. Co.
R. J. Brown Clerk B Co

Bourbon Cir Ct
vs
Chas Boynton
$25
3d May 1865

R J Brown
Pais Ky
Sent for fee
25th Apl
